title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Trump’s Attacks on Fed Overshadow a Critical Moment for the Central Bank
items.description: The president’s calls for Lisa Cook, a Fed governor, to resign are diverting attention from economic issues as top central bankers from around the wor...

items.title: With Fed under pressure, Jerome Powell prepares for a high-stakes speech
items.description: The Fed chair will speak Friday at an annual economic symposium in Jackson Hole, Wyo. The speech comes as the central bank is under mounting pressure ...

items.title: As Adams Tries to Run on His Record, Scandals Keep Swirling Around Him
items.description: Mayor Eric Adams of New York has sought to argue that his first-term wins have earned him the right to serve a second. But he cannot shake the stench ...

items.title: An appeals court throws out a massive civil fraud penalty against President Trump
items.description: Trump, in a social media post, claimed "total victory" after the ruling, which spares him from a potential half-billion-dollar fine for decades of exa...

items.title: Walmart says tariff costs are rising 'each week' and will continue
items.description: The world's largest retailer — like many others — has been absorbing most of the increased costs, but raising prices of some goods.

items.title: Gavin Newsom’s Redistricting Ballot Fight Raises $6.2 Million Online
items.description: The figure makes plain how a gerrymandering push that began in Texas but spread nationwide has energized the Democratic base.

items.title: NY Appeals Court Throws Out Trump’s Half-Billion-Dollar Fine in Civil Fraud Case
items.description: New York appeals judges said that the judgment was excessive, but agreed to uphold the case so the appeal could continue.

items.title: Artificial light has essentially lengthened birds' day
items.description: Millions of audio recordings of hundreds of bird species have revealed that artificial light is making the birds wake up earlier and go to bed later.

items.title: Hurricane Erin brings flooding to parts of Outer Banks as it pivots from East Coast
items.description: The storm flooded parts of North Carolina's Outer Banks, including a section of the main highway. It's now turning away from the East Coast, but dange...

items.title: Judge Says Alina Habba Has Acted Without Legal Authority
items.description: Defense lawyers had questioned whether Alina Habba, a Trump loyalist, was legally authorized to run the U.S. attorney’s office in New Jersey.

items.title: Europe Gets a Written Trump Trade Deal, With a Caveat for Automakers
items.description: Under the newly fleshed-out details, Washington will maintain high tariffs on vehicles imported from the bloc until the E.U. takes steps to lower its ...

items.title: Analysis: What Progress Has Trump Really Made in Ukraine Peace Talks?
items.description: Nearly a week after President Trump’s Alaska summit, his suggestions of imminent breakthroughs have not come to pass.

items.title: Israel’s Operation to Take Control of Gaza City Looms. Where Does It Stand?
items.description: The Israeli government is expanding its operation in Gaza, despite its generals’ advice and as it deliberates on a new cease-fire proposal.

items.title: Facing a ‘Reading Crisis,’ Denmark Wants to Make Books Cheaper
items.description: The Danish government announced this week that it planned to make books exempt from a 25 percent value-added tax.

items.title: French Authorities Investigate Death of Streamer Jean Pormanove After Months of Abuse
items.description: Raphaël Graven, known online as Jean Pormanove, was regularly subjected to humiliation and abuse on Kick, a streaming platform.
